movieReview: Still fine, I think I was less irritated by it the second time around.  Still doesn't add much of anything to JP.
Fairly standard biopic, which is never my favorite genre...
Tarantino keeps ratcheting up the tension over the first 2 hours, like a rollercoaster going up the first hill.  When he finally lets it go it GOES.  Wonderful.
About as funny as a story about an engineered global financial collapse could be.
Good, not great, felt like torture/misery porn at times.  Beautiful looking, though.  Tom Hardy was good as always.  DiCaprio also good.
Solid movie, terribly human for a puppet film, but I don't really understand why it needed to be a puppet film.  And the lines on the puppet heads were terribly distracting.
OK.  Felt to me like a series of disconnected set pieces...
Man I miss Bowie.
Decent for a TV movie.

Really good.  I loved how it kept going where most movies would have ended.  A standard telling of a story like this would have ended at the halfway point of this movie.  But it spent at least half its running time exploring the aftermath.
Second best short in the package.  Well made and interesting.
Totally beautiful but not actually interesting as a film.  Amazing art.
Cute, I guess, but meh
Was right up my alley but somehow fell flat for me.
movieTitle: We Can't Live Without The Cosmos

movieReview: Wonderful.  By far the best of the animated shorts in the package.
Had moments
Stories like this have been told over and over again.
movieTitle: The Short Story of a Fox and a Mouse

movieReview: Fun, perhaps a touch long...  One of the less bleak plymptoons.
Again, felt like I had seen this before.
Popular Man did some pretty bad things.
movieTitle: Steve Jobs: The Man in the Machine

movieReview: Great doc about a great woman.
It was OK.  Fun enough, a little too "Family Guy" for me.  Also the humor was weirdly late 80s-early 90s centric.  I don't understand how people younger than me would get much of it.
A profile of Cannon, one of the great B-Movie houses ever...
movieTitle: Electric Boogaloo: The Wild, Untold Story of Cannon Films

movieReview: Biopics aren't my favorite form, but this was a pretty good one...
Was feeling down after jury duty so I treated myself to a 4th screening of TFA.  Still great!
movieTitle: Star Wars: Episode VII - The Force Awakens

movieReview: Hadn't seen this in ages, and never in a theatre.  Wonderful.
movieTitle: Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders from Mars

movieReview: Creepy as hell...
3.5ish hour documentary on the making of Blade Runner, which was much more interesting than it sounds (at least it was to me).
Meh..  This was on a list (with Dangerous Days) of documentaries about particular films, but this one was more of a puff piece and spent too much time on the legacy.
I think I liked it better the second time, but it still kinda of meandered...  The opening action sequence felt VERY animated on my television, I don't remember noticing that in the theatre.
You can only make watching people play or talk about chess so interesting.
Fascinating look at some of the inanity of film shoots.  Lots of douchey behavior.
Really good thriller, not sure it actually has ANYTHING to do with the original CLOVERFIELD but who cares.
Nice, sweet film.  More of a gentle touch than I was expecting.
Ok, this is getting out of hand.  I do like this movie, but I think I'm being a little ridiculous.
movieTitle: Star Wars: Episode VII - The Force Awakens

movieReview: The best Spielberg movie since Lincoln.  Perhaps a little long, but it surprised me in little ways.
First half had me pretty engaged, but it got really boring after that...  Does *exactly* what it says on the box, which shouldn't surprise you becomes a pretty one-note affair.
Still really good...  Watching it with the knowledge that it was Ukranian Sign, not ASL, freed me to stop trying to understand the signs and just watch the film.
Amazingly terrible.  There were a few good moments but overall it was painfully boring.
A nice, sweet movie.  Easy to recommend.  Some really good performances...
Good, not great.  LORD OF THE FLIES meets SALO meets SNOWPIERCER as directed by Ben Wheatley.  Some of the female characters felt underdeveloped and I had difficulty keeping them straight.
Would have been better as a short.  Lots of what amounted to vignettes showing what we are like without memory.
A solid psychological thriller featuring two great performances from the leading actors.
A Youtuber is plucked from obscurity by chance and talent.
Guh this was really bad.  Didn't really get into the two topics it claimed to intertwine:  Mars Terraforming or Climate Change here.
Not Herzog's best, but very good.  Was fairer than I expected and had some really funny moments.
movieTitle: Lo And Behold: Reveries Of The Connected World

movieReview: I have to admit that I expected to hate Robbins, but while his seminars aren't for me, he doesn't seem like the scammer that I expected.   I understand how others may get what they need from his shows.
movieTitle: Tony Robbins: I Am Not Your Guru

movieReview: Good doc covering a punk scene I was totally unaware of:  the Latino backyard/underground scene in LA.
movieTitle: Los Punks: We Are All We Have

movieReview: Really tense and well acted.  Loved it.
Funny and nerdy...
Nice little meditation on how our immigration policy affects families.
Ok, felt wooden at times.
Nice, well constructed, with some great gags and good jokes.
Funny short about father and son bonding...
Wonderful animated short;  an update of the Romeo and Juliet balcony scene.
Ok, but felt forced...  I expected to love this one based on the great title but it just didn't really work for me.
movieTitle: My Dark Side and My Light Side Meet In a Bar to Discuss The New Star Wars Movie

movieReview: Very cute movie, super funny and enjoyable.
Not for me...   Felt like I've seen it before....
Great profile of a former Iraqi boxer and his family
Nice look at a piece of the $15 minimum wage movement in Boston
Depressing look at the prospects for some Appalachian children and some teachers trying to help.
Didn't work for me, felt abstracted from the children and I don't understand why it was in Black and White.
I did not like this at all.
A great look into a political campaign when crisis arises.  Quite engaging and entertaining..
A good profile of a musician I knew little about.  Felt a touch stretched, perhaps.
movieTitle: Colin Hay - Waiting For My Real Life

movieReview: A gentrification drama through the eyes of teens..  Liked how Sachs was made leaps in time/story w/o exposition
Good...  I wonder what my improv friends would think of it...
A solid relationship dramedy with some unique curves that kept me engaged.
Ok...  T'Challa was cool, Spiderman not, and lots and lots of punching..
Better than I expected, but still only OK.
Meh..  If you tune out and don't think about it, it is a competent thriller. But it's stupid, stupid, stupid...
A pretty good drama, tho that is mostly based on the real-life drama.
A nostalgic trip through my formative years in computing.
movieTitle: From Bedrooms to Billions: The Amiga Years!

movieReview: Funny, fun, and almost a throwback to buddy films that just don't get made anymore.
Didn't really feel like journalism...  Lots of 'grey area' stuff.
No surprise that men of power abuse that power.  That doesn't make it any less disgusting.
Good profile of Trent Harris and his masterwork, The Beaver Trilogy while also finally unearthing the story of Groovin' Gary
Bo's pretty weird, sometimes it works, others it doesn't...  But funny enough.
Not as good as I remembered....  Lots of "lets pause the story and plot for a 5 minute kung fu scene", which isn't exactly my thing...  Funny moments, but overall a meh..

OK, but not as funny as I wanted it to be.  Amusing at parts, funny enough, but not really something you need to see in a theatre.  Lots of comparisons to Sp?n?al Tap in reviews, but that is just insane.  It is nowhere near as good as Sp?n?al Tap.
Pretty good, though the kid really cheesed my goat.
Fascinating profile of several people who happen to share a name with History's worst person.
Really, really dumb.  Entertaining enough, but dumb as fuck.
Pretty good doc, profile of a fascinating filmmaker...  The doc itself had some construction problems but mostly minor.
Fascinating, probably the best doc of 2016....
Solid profile of a local Boston band that seemingly just missed the window...
movieTitle: Leave Behind a Groove in the Earth: The Story of Sam Black Church

movieReview: Snorefest....   Last hour was at least vaguely engaging, but it wasn't good.  We watched the Ultimate Edition, which I heard made more sense, but I doubt it...
movieTitle: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice

movieReview: Fantastic.  Jeremy Saulnier hasn't let me down yet...
This was a wonderful film, one of the best I've seen this year.  I was worried it would feel 'manufactured weird' but instead it felt magically weird.
Still quite good...  Amazing how engaging a story like this is.
A little long, but a fine haunting movie...  Pretty standard.
Good...  Fell apart in the last 3rd a bit but had me laughing and I definitely enjoyed myself.
A fairly straightforward gangster story, pretty long, not great.
Did some pregaming before watching the third "Kelvin" Star Trek...  This one is pretty good, not perfect...  Also it seems completely missing from previous film tracking...
This movie is worse than I remember....  Seemingly long and distracted...  Too many references to events from the 'original' trek with little payoff...  Just felt like a bad remix...
Easily the best of the modern "Kelvin Timeline" Treks for me...  Fun character moments, good action, least derivative of TOS...
A perfectly enjoyable action movie.  Tech was eyerollingly bad, and there was nothing special about it..  Definitely diminishing returns in this series.
Still good, but Shatner and Montalban really chew the fuck out of the scenery....
movieTitle: Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan

movieReview: Meh....  This plot is kinda dumb....  And there's something that feels forced by Spock dying in II then the plot of the entire next installment being his return..
movieTitle: Star Trek III: In Search of Spock

movieReview: The second time I saw this film and I still loved it.  Tarantino at his best...
An old look at an old controversy...  I was reminded of this recently in an article about Arseface on the show Preacher....
movieTitle: Dream Deceivers: The Story Behind James Vance vs. Judas Priest

movieReview: OK, but I feel like I've seen a version of this movie several times.  "Family questions it's unusually children rearing"... Had moments, but didn't feel particularly special.  "Little Mr. and Mrs Sunshines"
I hadn't even heard of Showbiz Pizza until a few years ago...  I honestly have no idea why I watched this doc...  Vaguely interesting.
Really good....  Really slow, tense buildup
Not so good....  Too goofy and cutesy.. Bothers me in the same way that Indiana Jones 3 does...
movieTitle: Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home

movieReview: Wonderful...  And the restoration (!) by Janus/Criterion lookgs gorgeous.  I can't believe it took me this long to see this film.
Meh....  Had some real highlights but mostly I felt kind of bored.  Not a bad cable watch, but I wouldn't recommend you pay for it.
Still great....  Morris firing on all cylinders (as he often does).
Fascinating...
Good heist flick...  Muddy on the motivations and a little too long
Powerful and sad.
Meh... Way too long, and overall boring...
Fun....  Intercut the history of the remake with the finishing of the final missing scene in 2015...  Great story.
movieTitle: Raiders!: The Story of the Greatest Fan Film Ever Made

movieReview: Saw this as part of the 70mm festival at the Somerville....  Looked great, but sounded amazing....  It had a mag, as opposed to the optical, soundtracks that were possible at the time...  And the theatre's sound system did it justice..
Interesting and fun.... I believe it was ALL archive photos and footage with interview audio..
Finally got around to seeing this, mostly because I felt like I was missing out on some cultural touchstone.  It was very good, some great songs and oddly intimate.
Among the longest two hours I've experienced...
Good, better than I expected given the genre.... Far more Jesus-y than I expected after the Intermission.  Glad I was able to see this in 35mm IB Technicolor, running out of time with these prints...
Interesting look at the apparent failure of a foreign legal system...
Pretty darned not good....  Mostly rehashing the first movie with younger actors, and way too many cameos from characters from the first film nobody cares about.
Good, terrifying, and I'm not sure I needed to see it in a theatre.
Way better than I expected...  Good action, plot and funnier than I expected.

Good, but I felt confused by the timeline at times.  I felt 'scenes' were omitted randomly.  I recognize they had to compress several years of legal drama into two hours, but at times I felt like I completely lost a grasp on how much time was elapsing, especially once the trial started.
Good and interesting...  Managed to form a sort of narrative without anything outside of the old video/interviews..  No real title cards, captions (other than translation) or explainers...
movieTitle: Eat That Question: Frank Zappa in His Own Words

movieReview: Still hilarious, and worked way better in a packed house.  Also had the treat of a Mel Brooks Q&A afterwards.
Very good still, and I forgot enough of it to still be surprised by the plot twists...
Heavy but very good...  Perhaps a little slow in the first act, but not enough to really bust it's chops.
Instantly one of my favorite movies of the year...  Fucked up in the best way...

Revisited this film because I've only seen the first two of the series and I feel like the guy who hasn't seen Star Wars at this point.  Still a kids movie, didn't really find more to like about it this time around, but I'm going to stick with the entire series at this point.  I found things to love in the Fast and Furious series, I'm sure there's things to love in the Harry Potter series.  Esp. once Chris Columbus gets out of the way.
movieTitle: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

movieReview: This was a fun movie, but I think I'll completely forget about it in a week.  Felt like "Iron Man but Magic" a bit too much..  Also felt too long.
This was fun but not great...  Kinda sagged at points and felt a little rote.
Pretty darned good...  A tad schmaltzy at points, but dealt with some very complex ideas elegantly.
Hard meh.  Beautiful looking but ultimately unfulfilling.
Good coming of age film, felt fresh, even though it touched the common tropes of the genre.
This was a movie.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't good...  Kinda sad, I guess, in a way?
Still OK...
Still pretty fun!
Wonderful...  Close to a perfect film.
Avoiding the "everything from the first film again" sequel trap, and instead getting more confusing and weirder.  Great.
It's been awhile, still wonderful.  And this edition I watched had a longer version of the Castle Anthrax scene which apparently has been added to some versions since the 90s but I had always missed.
movieTitle: Monty Python and the Holy Grail

movieReview: Good film, I had no idea it was an Ang Lee joint...  I have no idea how true it is...
I had no idea this person existed, and I'm not sure there was 90 minutes worth of material for a doc....
Ok, probably better than the first... WAY too long and pretty obvious...
movieTitle: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

movieReview: Garbage.  Not a single thing I can recommend.
A god-damned masterpiece.
Tried to catch lightning in a bottle a second time, and failed.. But still plenty of fun.
I find stories like this fascinating....   I can't be objective about them.
This was great, though it did feel a little long...  Seems like a great entre for those ignorant of modular synths as well as entertaining to those who are already familiar
Very good....  Very different tone from prior SW films while still retaining the heart of it.  Not perfect, but a bunch of fun.
Guh...  Very bland, non memorable music, paper thin plot, and no There There.  Gosling and Stone tried their damnedest, but the script was just not there.
Solid, but too long.
This time in 2D, which I vastly preferred.  I had an easier time keeping character names straight, but I thought the de-aged/digital actors stuck out even more this time.
It's a nice movie.  I don't love it, but it's aight.
lol I last saw this movie 4 years to the date...
Funny, tho some things really haven't held up well..
movieTitle: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me

movieReview: I don't remember ever seeing this movie before, but apparently I have.  I must have had too much to drink or fell asleep, because it was pretty funny..
Some traditions never die.
The best.  RIP Alan Rickman.
Oh fuuuuuudddddge.
A reasonable doc on the loss of internet freedom...
Lots of fun, sinlaws didn't seem to enjoy it much.
I saw this in 3D and in D-Box seats to humor my nephew...  But this time I had dead center seats and the 3D worked better....  Still not my favorite, but less annoying than my first viewing.
